data.text: @mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle You shouldn't have enabled the app. LOL. It's too busy exchanging data. Haha.

@jreayay @mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle This is most likely the answer.

Since the actual notification system is part of iOS and nothing to do with WA specifically, I guess potentially an out-of-state contact might still be reported, but I don't know for sure if states are cooperating that way or not.

@impasta007 @mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle That's not how this system works.  No locations are being tracked, and it's only logging a token from nearby phones, it doesn't know who those phones belong to.

@mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle I think you should be more concerned that the state is tracking your movements and logging other phones nearby. Why would you agree to this level of surveillance??

@mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle The expose notification system doesn’t ever record your location it just does proximity handshakes with other people using the system so it has no idea you are out of WA.

@mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle My understanding is that means someone else from WA with exposure notifications also traveled to where you are.  Your phone handshook with them while you were out of state so when they put in the positive result the notification worked because your both on the WA system.

@lnole @WADeptHealth @commoncircle For sure. Took a rapid test last night and was negative. As always I’ll be cognizant of any symptoms. 

It’s still v confusing why I’d get a notification tho… 🤷🏼‍♂️
@mattmillsphoto @WADeptHealth @commoncircle Wouldn’t hurt to just take a test.
